snippet: With the general election campaign about to start, President Obama is set to emphasize an issue that few Democratic candidates have made such a focus.
abstract: Pres Obama's presidential campaign will emphasize national security, long the domain of the Republican Party; with a record that includes winding down the Iraq war and killing Osama bin Laden, coupled with success of military strikes in Libya and the removal of Col Muammar el-Qaddafi, political and national security experts have embraced the Obama campaign's belief that this could be the year when national security issues actually help a Democrat.
lead_paragraph: With the general election campaign about to start, President Obama is set to emphasize an issue that few Democratic candidates have made such a focus.

headline.seo: Obama Embraces National Security as Campaign Issue
headline.main: Obama Embraces National Security as Campaign Issue
